tool.name: Kraken Report
tool.description: View a sample report of your classification.

param.name: kraken_output
param.label: Input the Sequenced Kraken Output from your Current History

param.name: DBSource
param.label: Which database did you use to generate this output?

param.name: ownFile
param.label: Select a database from your galaxy history

tool.help:
***Note that the database used must be the same as the one used to generate the output file, or the report script may encounter problems.***
**The output of kraken-report is tab-delimited, with one line per taxon. The fields of the output, from left-to-right, are as follows:**
1)Percentage of reads covered by the clade rooted at this taxon
2)Number of reads covered by the clade rooted at this taxon
3)Number of reads assigned directly to this taxon
4)A rank code, indicating (U)nclassified, (D)omain, (K)ingdom, (P)hylum, (C)lass, (O)rder, (F)amily, (G)enus, or (S)pecies. All other ranks are simply -.
5)NCBI taxonomy ID
6)Indented scientific name
The scientific names are indented using spaces, according to the tree structure specified by the taxonomy.
